channel.title: Helpppppppppp
channel.description:
I TRYED TO ADD THE TELEPORT COMMAND BUT IT SHOWED THIS ERROR WHEN I TRYED COMPILING
[img]http://imgtool.in/images/wowurcool.png[/img]

item.title: Helpppppppppp
item.dc:creator: @_N_eon (N)eon
item.description:
@_N_eon wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:6, topic:417344”] public class Stuff { if(playerCommand.equals("stuff")) { doMoreStuff(); } }
is your error. Statements must be in a method’s constructor.

public class Stuff {
    public void doStuff() {
        if(playerCommand.equals("stuff")) {
            doMoreStuff();
        }
    }
}

By adding the method, doStuff(), the statements are now error free, in theory.

Also for commands, use “equalsIgnoreCase” or “String.toLowerCase().startsWith” instead.[/quote]

He answered it for you lol

Read full topic

item.title: Helpppppppppp
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

public class Stuff {
    if(playerCommand.equals("stuff")) {
        doMoreStuff();
    }
}

is your error. Statements must be in a method’s constructor.

public class Stuff {
    public void doStuff() {
        if(playerCommand.equals("stuff")) {
            doMoreStuff();
        }
    }
}

By adding the method, doStuff(), the statements are now error free, in theory.

Also for commands, use “equalsIgnoreCase” or “String.toLowerCase().startsWith” instead.

Read full topic
